experiment_atac_short_read_id.description: Identifier for experiment_atac_short_read (primary key). RCs make their own IDs, must begin with center abbreviation as defined in participant table; need to be globally unique in consortium; may be generated by prepending experiment_sample_id with center abbreviation.

experiment_sample_id.description: Identifier used in the data file (e.g. the SM tag in a BAM header, column headers for genotype fields in a VCF file). May be the same as experiment_short_read_id if the file does contain sample identifiers. Should be present if downstream file contains a sample_id (e.g. BAM, VCF). Some centers have one id for the sample (tube) and a different ID for the sample as named in the VCF.

seq_library_prep_kit_method.description: Library prep kit used. Can be missing if RC receives external data.

read_length.description: Sequenced read length (bp); GREGoR RCs do paired end sequencing, so is the example of 100bp indicates 2x100bp. Can be missing if RC receives external data; all RCs are doing paired-end reads.

experiment_type.description: Type of experiment. Facilitates having exome and GS-SR experiments in the same experiment_details table.

targeted_regions_method.description: Which capture kit is used. Can be missing if RC receives external data.

targeted_region_bed_file.description: Name and path of bed file uploaded to workspace. Can be missing if RC receives external data.

date_data_generation.description: Date of data generation (First sequencing date). Can be missing if RC receives external data; ISO 8601 date format.

target_insert_size.description: Insert size the protocol targets for DNA fragments. Can be missing if RC receives external data.

sequencing_platform.description: Sequencing platform used for the experiment. Can be missing if RC receives external data.
